requirement: The organization must protect life, property, and the environment.
requirement_description: The organization is obligated to ensure safety for human lives, preserve properties, and maintain environmental integrity.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive plan to respond effectively and efficiently to emergencies, including natural disasters, fires, and health crises.
Provide regular safety training for all employees to ensure they are aware of potential hazards and know how to respond appropriately.
Establish a routine maintenance schedule for all equipment to minimize the risk of malfunction or failure that could potentially harm life, property, or the environment.
Conduct regular environmental impact assessments to identify and mitigate any negative effects of organizational activities on the environment.

requirement: The organization must consider the expectations of its interested parties.
requirement_description: The organization should take into account the views and needs of stakeholders who have an interest in its operations.

controls.control: Create a dedicated communication channel to regularly engage with interested parties, understand their expectations, and address any concerns or feedback
Develop a documented process for identifying, categorizing, and recording the expectations of interested parties to ensure consistency in meeting their needs

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Interested Parties Expectations
controls.control: Provide training to staff members on understanding and addressing the expectations of interested parties, ensuring a culture of customer-centricity

requirement: The organization must instill confidence in its ability to achieve success.
requirement_description: The organization is expected to demonstrate its competence and reliability to stakeholders.

controls.control: Develop measurable, achievable objectives that align with the organization's mission and vision
Ensure consistent, transparent, and timely communication to all stakeholders about the organization's progress and achievements

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Maintain a comprehensive business continuity plan that addresses potential risks and ensures smooth operations during crises

requirement: The organization must enhance its ability to continue operations during disruptions.
requirement_description: The organization should strive for business continuity and disaster recovery preparedness.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan (BCP)
controls.control: Create, maintain, and regularly test a comprehensive BCP that includes critical business functions, key personnel, facilities, technology infrastructure, and suppliers.
Provide secure remote access to employees for essential work tasks during disruptions. Ensure that remote work policies, procedures, and equipment are in place.
Maintain redundant IT infrastructure, such as servers, storage systems, and network devices, to minimize downtime during disruptions.
Regularly conduct disaster recovery drills to test the effectiveness of the BCP and identify areas for improvement.

requirement: The organization must demonstrate effective and efficient risk management.
requirement_description: The organization is required to identify, assess, and mitigate risks in a timely and appropriate manner.

controls.control: Develop, document, and implement a comprehensive risk management framework that includes identification, assessment, mitigation, monitoring, and reporting of risks.
Regularly assess the organization's operations, systems, and assets to identify potential risks and their impact on the business.
Create strategies for responding to identified risks, including avoidance, transfer, mitigation, or acceptance.
Develop and implement a process for reporting risk findings, status, and recommendations to relevant stakeholders on a regular basis.

0.3   Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) cycle 
This document applies the Plan (establish), Do (implement and operate), Check (monitor and review) 
and Act (maintain and improve) (PDCA) cycle to implement, maintain and continually improve the 
effectiveness of an organization’s BCMS. 
This ensures a degree of consistency with other management systems standards, such as ISO  9001, 
ISO 14001, ISO/IEC 20000-1, ISO/IEC 27001 and ISO 28000, thereby supporting consistent and 
integrated implementation and operation with related management systems. 
In accordance with the PDCA cycle, Clauses 4 to 10 cover the following components. 
• — Clause 4 introduces the requirements necessary to establish the context of the BCMS 
applicable to the organization, as well as needs, requirements and scope.  
• — Clause 5 summarizes the requirements specific to top management’s role in the BCMS, 
and how leadership articulates its expectations to the organization via a policy statement.  
• — Clause 6 describes the requirements for establishing strategic objectives and guiding 
principles for the BCMS as a whole. 
• — Clause 7 supports BCMS operations related to establishing competence and 
communication on a recurring/as-needed basis with interested parties, while documenting, 
controlling, maintaining and retaining required documented information. 
• — Clause 8 defines business continuity needs, determines how to address them and 
develops procedures to manage the organization during a disruption. 
• — Clause 9 summarizes the requirements necessary to measure business continuity 
performance, BCMS conformity with this document, and to conduct management review.  
• — Clause 10 identifies and acts on BCMS nonconformity and continual improvement through 
corrective action.

requirement: The organization shall establish the context of the BCMS applicable to it.
requirement_description: The organization must define the aspects and interested parties relevant to its business continuity management system.

controls.control: Clearly outline the areas, locations, and activities within the organization that will be covered by the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
List all internal and external parties who may impact, or be impacted by, the organization's ability to prepare for, respond to, and recover from a business disruption
Establish specific goals and targets for the BCMS that align with the organization's overall objectives and risk appetite
Prepare a written statement describing the organization, its locations, operations, external providers, customers, suppliers, and any other parties that are essential to the functioning of the BCMS

controls.control_title: Define Top Management's Role in BCMS
controls.control: Develop a clear and concise policy statement outlining the role of top management in the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS), including their responsibilities, expectations, and commitment.
Disseminate the policy statement to all employees, ensuring they understand their role in the BCMS and the importance of adhering to it.

Maintain a documented version of the BCMS policy statement, ensuring it is easily accessible to relevant personnel and can be referred to in the event of a business disruption.

requirement: An organization shall implement a Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)

controls.control: Develop, document, and communicate a comprehensive BCMS policy that outlines the organization's approach to business continuity and disaster recovery.

Maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS policy, plans, procedures, and any changes made over time.

requirement_title: Implement, Maintain and Improve a BCMS
article_text:
Information marked as “NOTE” is for guidance in understanding or clarifying the associated 
requirement. “Notes to entry” used in Clause 3 provide additional information that supplements the 
terminological data and can contain provisions relating to the use of a term. 
1   Scope 
This document specifies requirements to implement, maintain and improve a management system to 
protect against, reduce the likelihood of the occurrence of, prepare for, respond to and recover from 
disruptions when they arise. 
The requirements specified in this document are generic and intended to be applicable to all 
organizations, or parts thereof, regardless of type, size and nature of the organization. The extent of 
application of these requirements depends on the organization’s operating environment and 
complexity. 
This document is applicable to all types and sizes of organizations that: 
• a) implement, maintain and improve a BCMS; 
• b) seek to ensure conformity with stated business continuity policy; 
• c) need to be able to continue to deliver products and services at an acceptable predefined 
capacity during a disruption; 
• d) seek to enhance their resilience through the effective application of the BCMS.  
This document can be used to assess an organization’s ability to meet its own business continuity 
needs and obligations. 
2   Normative references 
The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some or all of their content 
constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For 
undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) 
applies. 
• ISO 22300, Security and resilience — Vocabulary 
3   Terms and definitions 
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in ISO 22300 and the following 
apply. 
NOTE The terms and definitions given below supersede those given in ISO 22300:2018. 
3.1 
activity 
set of one or more tasks with a defined output 
[SOURCE:ISO 22300:2018, 3.1, modified — The definition has been replaced and the example has 
been deleted.] 
3.2 
audit 
systematic, independent and documented process (3.26) for obtaining audit evidence and evaluating 
it objectively to determine the extent to which the audit criteria are fulfilled  
Note 1 to entry: An audit can be an internal audit (first party) or an external audit (second party or third 
party), and it can be a combined audit (combining two or more disciplines).
requirement: Implement, maintain and improve a BCMS
requirement_description: Organizations must establish, maintain, and continuously improve their Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to ensure preparedness for potential disruptions.

controls.control: Develop and document a comprehensive BCMS policy that outlines the organization's approach to business continuity.
Identify essential business functions, processes, and systems required for the organization to continue operations during a disruption.
Create detailed plans for each identified critical function, outlining steps to maintain or quickly resume operations in the event of a disruption.
Designate specific individuals or teams responsible for managing the BCMS, including incident response and recovery activities.
Provide regular training to employees on their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any necessary procedures for responding to disruptions.
Regularly test the BCMS plans through exercises and drills to ensure their effectiveness in real-world scenarios.
Keep BCMS documentation current, including policies, plans, procedures, and contact lists, to reflect changes within the organization or its environment.

requirement_description: Organizations must adhere to their established business continuity policies.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Create, document, and regularly update a comprehensive business continuity plan that outlines procedures for responding to various types of disruptions.
Conduct periodic testing of the business continuity plan to ensure its effectiveness and identify any areas for improvement.
Develop and implement a communication protocol that outlines how information will be shared during a disruption, including with employees, customers, and stakeholders.
Regularly backup critical data and store off-site to ensure its availability during a disruption.
Identify the critical functions and systems that are essential for business operations, and prioritize their protection and recovery in the event of a disruption.

requirement_title: Maintain Ability to Deliver Products and Services During a Disruption
article_text:
Information marked as “NOTE” is for guidance in understanding or clarifying the associated 
requirement. “Notes to entry” used in Clause 3 provide additional information that supplements the 
terminological data and can contain provisions relating to the use of a term. 
1   Scope 
This document specifies requirements to implement, maintain and improve a management system to 
protect against, reduce the likelihood of the occurrence of, prepare for, respond to and recover from 
disruptions when they arise. 
The requirements specified in this document are generic and intended to be applicable to all 
organizations, or parts thereof, regardless of type, size and nature of the organization. The extent of 
application of these requirements depends on the organization’s operating environment and 
complexity. 
This document is applicable to all types and sizes of organizations that: 
• a) implement, maintain and improve a BCMS; 
• b) seek to ensure conformity with stated business continuity policy; 
• c) need to be able to continue to deliver products and services at an acceptable predefined 
capacity during a disruption; 
• d) seek to enhance their resilience through the effective application of the BCMS.  
This document can be used to assess an organization’s ability to meet its own business continuity 
needs and obligations. 
2   Normative references 
The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some or all of their content 
constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For 
undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) 
applies. 
• ISO 22300, Security and resilience — Vocabulary 
3   Terms and definitions 
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in ISO 22300 and the following 
apply. 
NOTE The terms and definitions given below supersede those given in ISO 22300:2018.

requirement: Maintain ability to deliver products and services during a disruption
requirement_description: Organizations must ensure they can continue delivering their products and services at an acceptable level during a disruption.

controls.control: Develop, document, and regularly test a comprehensive BCP that includes procedures for maintaining essential functions during disruptions.
Provide secure remote access to critical systems and applications for employees, ensuring business continuity even when physical access is limited or impossible.
Regularly backup essential data and store backups off-site to ensure quick recovery in the event of a disruption at the primary location.
Periodically test the BCP and disaster recovery procedures to identify any gaps or weaknesses and ensure that employees are familiar with their roles and responsibilities during a disruption.
Implement redundant infrastructure for critical systems, such as servers, networking equipment, and power supplies, to minimize the impact of hardware failures or other disruptions.

requirement: Enhance resilience through effective application of BCMS
requirement_description: Organizations should aim to improve their resilience by effectively implementing and utilizing their Business Continuity Management System (BCMS).

controls.control: Create, maintain, and regularly update a comprehensive BCMS document that outlines the organization's approach to business continuity.
Identify essential business functions, processes, and systems required for the organization to continue operations during a disruption.
Designate key personnel responsible for managing the BCMS, including incident management, communication, and recovery efforts.
Provide training to employees on their roles and responsibilities in the event of a disruption, as well as any necessary procedures for business continuity.
Regularly test the BCMS through exercises and drills to ensure its effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
